meanings.definition: To make longer in space or time
meanings.sent1: I will extend my hand to reach the cookie jar on the top shelf.
meanings.sent2: The road will extend all the way to the next town.
meanings.sent3: I tried to extend my legs to touch the ceiling, but I couldn't reach!
meanings.sent4: Her patience seemed to extend for miles, never running out.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked us to extend our arms as far as we could to measure the length of the room.

meanings.sent1: The cat will extend its claws to scratch the post.
meanings.sent2: She decided to extend her legs after sitting for a long time.
meanings.sent3: I tried to extend my arms like a superhero, but I just ended up looking silly.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to extend endlessly into the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's arms seemed to extend gracefully as she moved across the stage.

meanings.sent1: I will extend an invitation to my friend for the party.
meanings.sent2: The hotel will extend a warm welcome to all its guests.
meanings.sent3: I decided to extend my help to the new student struggling with the assignment.
meanings.sent4: The company decided to extend their services to reach more customers.
meanings.sent5: The library will extend its opening hours during exam season to help students study.
